title: Ann Patchett refuses to buy a smartphone. Maybe that’s why she’s written so many books.
text: She sees it all the time. (We see it in Danny.) A man can seem “so lovely, so smart and charming” while “the women who are holding him up and making his life possible” can seem spiteful, arrogant and “in competition with one another, because it is the way the man has set it up, that everybody’s trying to do everything for him and sort of stepping on one another.” When people ask if it was hard to write in the voice of a man, she says: “No, it was a snap, because I know the guy well. And I feel like his circumstance is a circumstance that’s repeated in every direction in my life.”
description: Last week, Patchett released her latest novel, ‘The Dutch House’
